    • Method Detail

      • registerVirtualMachine

        public void registerVirtualMachine(java.lang.String name)
        Method that implements the method VirtualizationToolManager::registerVirtualMachine(String).
        If there occurs any error while the registration operation is being processed, then there can be thrown one of the following exceptions:
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine name is null or empty
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the virtual machine of the given name is not present in the default VirtualBox machine folder or there cannot be opened the virtual hard disk which is specified in the configuration file
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when the physical machine, on which the virtual machine should be registered, is not connected or if there occurs any connection problem during comunication with the remote VirtualBox web server like:
          1. incorrect key values of physical machine (IP address, port number of VirtualBox web server, username or user password)
          2. remote VirtualBox web server is not running
          3. network connection is not working properly or at all
          If any of the mentioned error occurs then the physical machine will be automatically disconnected.
        Specified by:
        registerVirtualMachine in interface VirtualizationToolManager
        Parameters:
        name - represents the name of virtual machine which should be registered

      • findVirtualMachineById

        public VirtualMachine findVirtualMachineById(java.util.UUID id)
        Method that implements the method VirtualizationToolManager::findVirtualMachineById().
        This method is implemented the same as the method findVirtualMachineByName(String). One difference is that if occurs problem, then the following exception can be thrown:
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine uuid is null
        Specified by:
        findVirtualMachineById in interface VirtualizationToolManager
        Parameters:
        id - virtual machine uuid
        Returns:
        matched virtual machine if success, null otherwise

      • findVirtualMachineByName

        public VirtualMachine findVirtualMachineByName(java.lang.String name)
        Method implements the method VirtualizationToolManager::findVirtualMachineByName(String).
        If there occurs error, then one of the following exceptions can be thrown:
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine name is null or empty
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when the host machine is not connected or one of the further problems occur:
          1. incorrect key values of physical machine (IP address, port number of VirtualBox web server, username or user password)
          2. remote VirtualBox web server is not running
          3. network connection is not working properly or at all
          If any of the mentioned error occurs then the physical machine will be automatically disconnected.
        Specified by:
        findVirtualMachineByName in interface VirtualizationToolManager
        Parameters:
        name - represents the virtual machine name
        Returns:
        matched virtual machine if success, null otherwise

      • getVirtualMachines

        public java.util.List<VirtualMachine> getVirtualMachines()
        Method that implements the method VirtualizationToolManager::getVirtualMachines().
        If there occurs error, then one of the following exceptions can be thrown:
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when the host machine is not connected or one of the further problems occur:
          1. incorrect key values of physical machine (IP address, port number of VirtualBox web server, username or user password)
          2. remote VirtualBox web server is not running
          3. network connection is not working properly or at all
          If any of the mentioned error occurs then the physical machine will be automatically disconnected.
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when there occurs any VirtualBox error
        Specified by:
        getVirtualMachines in interface VirtualizationToolManager
        Returns:
        list of all registered virtual machines from the host machine

      • removeVirtualMachine

        public void removeVirtualMachine(VirtualMachine virtualMachine)
        Method that implements the method VirtualizationToolManager::removeVirtualMachine(VirtualMachine).

        This method completely removes the specified virtual machine from the host machine. So virtual machine is not only unregistered, but all its files are destroyed.

        This implementation works differently than the standard user APIs for managing VirtualBox like VBoxManage or VirtualBox GUI which do not remove those virtual machines that have any child (linked clone). This implementation remove all the nested tree from the the specified virtual machine recursively. So with this method can be virtual machines removed faster and easier, but it is also less safe, because there can happen the virtual machine which was not intended to be removed is removed as a child of any other virtual machine. If there occurs any error, then the following exceptions can be thrown:

        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when the host machine is not connected or one of the further problems occur:
          1. incorrect key values of physical machine (IP address, port number of VirtualBox web server, username or user password)
          2. remote VirtualBox web server is not running
          3. network connection is not working properly or at all
          If any of the mentioned error occurs then the physical machine will be automatically disconnected.
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the specified virtual machine is not in the list of registered virtual machines on the remote physical machine
        • IllegalStateException - thrown when the specified virtual machine was found as registered virtual machine, but a few moments later if it should be unregistered, because it is not accessible, it throw the vbox exception
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine which should be removed is not powered off
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine is null or its host machine is not correct
        Specified by:
        removeVirtualMachine in interface VirtualizationToolManager
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents the virtual machine which should be removed

      • cloneVirtualMachine

        public VirtualMachine cloneVirtualMachine(VirtualMachine virtualMachine,
                                          CloneType cloneType)
        Method that implements the method VirtualizationToolManager::cloneVirtualMachine(VirtualMachine,cloneType).
        With implementation of this method it is possible to create four different clone types - 3 types of full clones and one type of linked clone. Full clones are different in states which are used for cloning operation from the original virtual machine and specified with CloneType. Full clones are completely independent on the original virtual machines. But it takes a longer time to create a full clone. Linked clone is created much quicker, but it depends on the original virtual machine. Names of full clones are formed from the name of the original virtual machine and the suffix "_FullCloneX", where X is the lowest available number. The same works for linked clones, but instead of "_FullCloneX" it uses suffix "_LinkedCloneY", where Y is determined by the same way as X. If there occurs an error, then there can be thrown one of the following exception:
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when the host machine is not connected or one of the further problems occur:
          1. incorrect key values of physical machine (IP address, port number of VirtualBox web server, username or user password)
          2. remote VirtualBox web server is not running
          3. network connection is not working properly or at all
          If any of the mentioned error occurs then the physical machine will be automatically disconnected.
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the specified virtual machine is not in the list of registered virtual machines on the remote physical machine
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine is not accessible or it is not in a required state ("running","poweredOff", "paused","saved")
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when either the given virtual machine or clone type is null or virtual machine host machine is not correct
        Specified by:
        cloneVirtualMachine in interface VirtualizationToolManager
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents the virtual machine which should be cloned
        cloneType - specifies the type of the final clone
        Returns:
        virtual machine clone

      • close

        public void close()
        Method that implements the method VirtualizationToolManager::close().
        This method is implemented using VirtualMachineManager::getVMState(VirtualMachine) and VirtualMachineManager::shutDownVM(VirtualMachine). So this method shuts down all running virtual machines of a particular physical machine. If error occurs, then the following exceptions can be thrown:
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when the host machine is not connected or one of the further problems occur:
          1. incorrect key values of physical machine (IP address, port number of VirtualBox web server, username or user password)
          2. remote VirtualBox web server is not running
          3. network connection is not working properly or at all
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the specified virtual machine is not in the list of registered virtual machines on the remote physical machine
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine is not accessible or it is not in a required state
        Specified by:
        close in interface VirtualizationToolManager
